name: processed_timestamp
description: Timestamp of when the data was processed

name: feature_date
description: The date serving as basis for the features calculation

name: lifetime_purchasers_users
description: The number of distinct users who have purchases in the lifetime

name: lifetime_average_daily_purchasers
description: The average number of purchasers across all the days in the lifetime

name: lifetime_active_users
description: The number of distinct users who visited your website or application in the lifetime. An active user is any user who has an engaged session or when Analytics collects: the first_visit event or engagement_time_msec parameter from a website the first_open event or engagement_time_msec parameter from an Android app the first_open or user_engagement event from an iOS app

name: lifetime_DAU
description: The average number of users who engaged for the calendar day in the lifetime

name: lifetime_MAU
description: The average number of users who engaged in the last 30 days in the lifetime

name: lifetime_WAU
description: The average number of users who engaged in the last week in the lifetime

name: lifetime_dau_per_mau
description: Daily Active Users (DAU) / Monthly Active Users (MAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged for the calendar day out of the users who engaged in the last 30 days in the lifetime. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention

name: lifetime_dau_per_wau
description: Daily Active Users (DAU) / Weekly Active Users (WAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged in the last 24 hours out of the users who engaged in the last 7 days in the lifetime. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention

name: lifetime_wau_per_mau
description: Weekly Active Users (DAU) / Monthly Active Users (MAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged in the last 7 days out of the users who engaged in the last 30 days in the lifetime. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention

name: lifetime_users_engagement_duration_seconds
description: The average length of time that your app screen was in the foreground or your web page was in focus in seconds in the lifetime

name: lifetime_average_engagement_time
description: The average time that your website was in focus in a user's browser or an app was in the foreground of a user's device in the lifetime. Average engagement time = total user engagement durations / number of active users

name: lifetime_average_engagement_time_per_session
description: The average engagement time per session in the lifetime

name: lifetime_average_sessions_per_user
description: The average number of sessions per user in the lifetime

name: lifetime_ARPPU
description: Average revenue per paying user (ARPPU) is the total purchase revenue per active user who made a purchase in the lifetime

name: lifetime_ARPU
description: Average revenue per active user (ARPU) is the total revenue generated on average from each active user, whether they made a purchase or not in the lifetime. ARPU = (Total ad revenue + purchase revenue + in-app purchase revenue + subscriptions) / Active users

name: lifetime_average_daily_revenue
description: Average daily revenue The average total revenue for a day over the lifetime

name: lifetime_max_daily_revenue
description: The maximum total revenue for a day over the lifetime

name: lifetime_min_daily_revenue
description: The minimum total revenue for a day over the lifetime

name: lifetime_new_users
description: The number of new unique user IDs that logged the first_open or first_visit event in the lifetime. The metric allows you to measure the number of users who interacted with your site or launched your app for the first time

name: lifetime_returning_users
description: The number of users who have initiated at least one previous session in the lifetime, regardless of whether or not the previous sessions were engaged sessions

name: lifetime_first_time_purchasers
description: The number of users who made their first purchase in the lifetime.

name: lifetime_first_time_purchaser_conversion
description: The percentage of active users who made their first purchase in the lifetime. This metric is returned as a fraction; for example, 0.092 means 9.2% of active users were first-time purchasers

name: lifetime_first_time_purchasers_per_new_user
description: The average number of first-time purchasers per new user in the lifetime

name: lifetime_avg_user_conversion_rate
description: The average number of converting user per total users in the lifetime

name: lifetime_avg_session_conversion_rate
description: The average number of converting session per total sessions in the lifetime
